Old Gas lamp post at Madison Sq., N.Y.                  1884 Arm of the Statue of Liberty on display in Madison Sq. Park (during campaign to raise funds for its erection in
1886)

At left, Broadway

Photograph by Brown Brothers
220 West 42nd St.
New York City

Neg. # 1286

721485f.text:
Fifth Avenue and Broadway, north from 23rd Street and environs. From left to right respectively are Broadway, Fifth Avenue, Madison Square (Park) and the well known amusement center, Madison Square Garden. E. 26th Street forms the northerly rim of the park. In the right foreground is the seated statue of William Seward, Sec'y of State in President Lincoln's cabinet. The Worth monument is at the triangular apex formod by Broadway and Fifth Avenue. Prominent on the latter thoroughfare are, the Marble Collegiate Church, the Hotel Waldorf-Astoris and tho Prick Presbyterian Church.
1893
J. S. Johnston, photo
Copyright 1894
Ewing Galloway

721522f-a.text:
General Views:

(1) Tower of Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, at left on Madison, at right Flatiron Building at intersection of Fifth Avenue and Broadway, looking south.

(2) Madison Square looking west across Fifth Avenue. Flatiron Building shown at intersection of Broadway and Fifth Avenue.

731176f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Decoration Day Parade.
731176f-a.text:
Celebrations, Parades and Muricipal Events: The Decoration Day Parade passinm the Columbian Bell at the Worth Monument. The marchers are on Fifth Avenue while Broadway forms the left background. This photo is a companion to those that appeared on page 698 of the June 16, 1894 issue of the Illustrated American.
Vol. 15.
May 30, 1894.
TNe Illustrated American
